item.title: Adobe TV
item.description: Adobe TV launches today, and very useful it looks too.

item.title: Time to get nekkid again
item.description: Well it doesn't seem like 12 months since the last one, but we're getting our CSS off again for CSS Naked Day. We'll be covering ourselves up again tomorrow.

item.title: Here's lookin' at you kid
item.description: An rather unnerving mouse driven moving portrait thing at cubo.cc

item.title: Join David Powers for an online Dreamweaver seminar
item.description: foED author extraordinaire David Powers is taking part in Adobe Developer Week this Friday, with a session sharing the name of his latest book 'The Essential Guide to Dreamweaver CS3 with CSS, Ajax, and PHP'. Register now, over at Adobe

item.title: We're at SXSW
item.description: If you're in Austin, TX for SXSW Interactive be sure to stop by and see us and Apress at our booth.

item.title: Solar, with Lyrics
item.description: We love Processing. We love Flight 404's Goldfrapp Video.

item.title: Shake your BOTY
item.description: It's Netdiver Best of the Year time again. To quote, "These folks whatever their disciplines create memorable and dazzling projects, taking us to uncharted territories where imagination, skill, talent abide - inciting us to keep pushing forward."

item.title: Safer Internet Day 2008
item.description: Hey, let's be careful out there

item.title: Super Tuesday
item.description: This Tuesday is important—Use your vote! That's right, make sure you vote on Flex Feature Requests and Bugs. More here. Well, what did you think we meant?

item.title: YouTube Partner Program Extended
item.description: If you're in the US, Canada, or now the UK you can make money from posting your videos on YouTube by signing up to their Partner Program. Watch out for our forthcoming title Creating Video for the Web: Podcasts, Ads, and More if you want to learn how to do it properly.

item.title: What Was Won?
item.description: Good luck to ex-'foEDian' Catherine O'Flynn who's up for the Costa Book of the Year award this evening. Of course we knew her when she was still a web editor!

item.title: FWA Awards 2007
item.description: There's just one winner this year at FWA, with Get the Glass! winning both the Site of the Year, and the People's Choice award. Well, it had to be, didn't it?

item.title: Macworld SF keynote bingo
item.description: Mackids around the world will, as ever, be hanging on Steve Jobs' every word during the Macworld SF keynote. Why not make it more interesting, with a spot of keynote bingo. And, one more thing ...Check out MacsimumNews for some rather handy coupons to download—including one from us. Enjoy!

item.title: Standards Champion
item.description: Amongst the many other worthy winners at the .net awards this year was none other than Web Standards Solutions author, Dan Cederholm, picking up the award as Standards Champion. Better luck next time Bruce!

item.title: Gimme Gimme Gimme
item.description: Flex 3 Public Beta 3 available at labs right now! And, in case you hadn't noticed, our new Flex titles are all Flex 3 compatible.

item.title: Gary's Bike Jump
item.description: In honor of the late, great, Evel Knievel let's have a little retro Flash gaming. Time to revisit the old easter egg that was Gary's Bike Jump

item.title: PHP and Apache in Leopard
item.description: Ace author David Powers has a useful guide to getting up and running with PHP and Apache in Leopard, over at foundationphp.com

item.title: How to Conquer the Web
item.description: Inc.com features an interview with Web Design and Marketing Solutions for Business Websites' author Kevin Potts

item.title: SWX for Prizes
item.description: foED books are among the prizes on offer in Aral Balkan's SWX Contest

item.title: don't touch the blue cup
item.description: you didn't did you?

item.title: Pretty in Pink
item.description: We know we look good in pink, but the color appears to be catching on in sport too.

item.title: Learn CSS from the Master[y]
item.description: Andy Budd, author of CSS Mastery, is running a CSS workshop in Brighton, UK, in January. More details at the Clearleft website

item.title: Oh I do like to be beside the seaside
item.description: foED are heading for the beach.I hope you can join us!

item.title: Bringing HD Flash Video to the Web
item.description: Everyone's favorite Flash video author, Tom Green, has a great HD Flash video article up at Digital Web

item.title: Leopard
item.description: Only 10 days to go before Leopardships, and not long to wait until our Getting StartED with Mac OS X Leopard book.
